result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Anthony Randolph was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by the completion prison sentence.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the completion prison sentence. DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Court orders that the balance of any unpaid remaining court costs and surcharges be converted to a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: with credit for 120 days time served, CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 5 & 6.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: with credit for 120 days time served, CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 4 & 6.
Concurrent with: with credit for 120 days time served, CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 4 & 5.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Anthony Randolph

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed:  Certification of Filing of Transcript and ORIGINAL Transcript (24 pages) of PLEA AND SENTENCING held on September 11, 2015 before the Honorable Frederick C. Rosa.
No appearances. Court recalls case. Court orders that the balance of any unpaid remaining court costs and surcharges be converted to a civil judgment.

Defendant Charles Anthony Randolph in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Charles Anthony Randolph in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 4, 5 and 6. Court orders COUNT 7 dismissed and read-in. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Statements made as to sentencing.  
As to COUNT 4: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 33 MONTHS, with credit for 120 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 5 & 6 .  
As to COUNT 5: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 33 MONTHS, with credit for 120 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 4 & 6 .  
As to COUNT 6: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 33 MONTHS, with credit for 120 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 4 & 5.  
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by the completion prison sentence. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by the completion prison sentence. DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, defendant Charles Anthony Randolph not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was not produced from the HOC.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Anthony Randolph not in court, defendant in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No appearance by defense counsel. Case will follow co-defendants case.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Douglas E. Batt in court, Defendant Charles Anthony Randolph not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced from the House of Correction for purposes of this hearing. Defendant will not be produced for the next hearing in Branch 7.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Charles Anthony Randolph in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Defendant Charles Anthony Randolph in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Co-Defendant Kendall Acoff.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charles Anthony Randolph in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Charles Anthony Randolph in custody.  
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
